description:
A component for styling textual content ## Variant Variant takes care of - almost - all use-cases when it comes to texts on pages. Their name reflects the places they meant to be used. It sets `font family`, `size`, `weight` and `lineHeight`. > We recommend using `variant` instead of setting values directly. NOTE: when `variant` is set, `size`, `weight`, `fontStyle` and `lineHeight` props are ignored ```js --- type: example ---
descriptionPage
descriptionSection
content
contentImportant
contentQuote
contentSmall
legend
``` ### Text colors ```js --- type: example ---
I'm primary text
I'm secondary text
I'm brand text
I'm success text
I'm warning text
I'm danger text
I'm an ai-highlight text
I'm primary-inverse text
I'm secondary-inverse text
 I'm primary-on text
I'm secondary-on text
``` ### Font sizes ```js --- type: example ---
x-small
small
medium
large
x-large
xx-large
``` ### Font weights ```js --- type: example ---
light text
normal text
bold text
``` ### Font styles ```js --- type: example ---
I'm italic text
I'm normal text
``` ### Line heights ```js --- type: example ---

default: {lorem.paragraph()}

fit: {lorem.paragraph()}

condensed: {lorem.paragraph()}

double: {lorem.paragraph()}
``` ### Text transformations ```js --- type: example ---
I'm capitalized text
I'm uppercase text
I'M LOWERCASE TEXT
``` ### Letter-spacing ```js --- type: example ---
I'm normal text
I'm condensed text
I'm expanded uppercase text
``` ### Wrap Use `wrap="break-word"` to force breaking in long strings that would otherwise exceed the bounds of their containers. ```js --- type: example ---
superlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstring superlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstringsuperlongstring
``` ### Element styles You can use simple HTML tags to style your text. ```js --- type: example --- bold strong italic emphasis 
preformatted
code
This sup normal sub text. ``` ### DEPRECATED legacy values Multiple values from `size`, `weight` and `lineHeight` are deprecated, but still supported for backward compatibility reasons. Please only use the above listed, semantic values. Deprecated `size` values: `descriptionPage`, `descriptionSection`, `content`, `contentSmall`, `legend` Deprecated `weight` values: `weightRegular`, `weightImportant` Deprecated `lineHeight` values: `lineHeight100`, `lineHeight125`, `lineHeight150`

as.description: the element type to render as

tsType.name: union
tsType.raw:
| 'primary'
| 'secondary'
| 'brand'
| 'success'
| 'danger'
| 'warning'
| 'primary-inverse'
| 'secondary-inverse'
| 'primary-on' // used on colored surfaces like warning, same color in dark and light themes
| 'secondary-on' // used on colored surfaces like warning, same color in dark and light themes
| 'ai-highlight'

elementRef.description: Provides a reference to the underlying HTML element

lineHeight.description:
Line height. Use `variant` if possible instead.
`lineHeight100`, `lineHeight125`, `lineHeight150` are deprecated

size.description:
Size of the text. Use `variant` if possible instead.
`descriptionPage`, `descriptionSection`, `content`, `contentSmall`,
`legend` are deprecated

variant.description:
Sets multiple props at once. (size, fontStyle, lineHeight, weight)
If set, these props are not allowed.
NOTE: this is the recommended way of setting these values

weight.description:
Weight of the text. Use `variant` if possible instead.
`weightRegular`, `weightImportant` are deprecated
